title: Draft exam registration UI with multi-theme preview (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Build a frontend-only, mocked multi-step exam registration flow with the required minimal screens and navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: App can be run as a static front-end with no required backend calls.
User can navigate through a complete exam-registration flow: start -> select exam -> enter details -> review -> confirmation.
All data is mocked/held in client state only and resets on refresh.

file_operations.description: Create the app shell that hosts the registration flow, including shared layout (header/content/actions) and client-only state wiring for the flow screens (no backend usage). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) to keep the UI concise and consistent. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement the flow controller (step state machine) and in-memory draft registration state; provide handlers to move forward/back and reset on completion (refresh resets by default).

Create the Landing/Start screen with brief copy and a single primary action to begin registration. Use shadcn-ui Button/Card to present a sleek start state. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Exam Selection screen using mocked exam options and a clear primary action to proceed. Use shadcn-ui Select and Card to keep interaction minimal and readable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Registration Details screen that hosts the form fields (wired to client state only) and supports back/next navigation. Use shadcn-ui form primitives (Input/Label/Checkbox) for consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Review screen that summarizes the entered data (read-only) with clear primary (confirm) and secondary (edit/back) actions. Use shadcn-ui Card/Button for consistent hierarchy. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Confirmation screen with a concise success message and a single action to start over (reset client state). Use shadcn-ui Card/Button to keep it sleek. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the React entry point renders the new App and remains frontend-only (no required backend calls); keep providers but avoid introducing authentication flows.

requirements.summary: Add at least two sleek theme variants (dark-only + color-theory palette) and an in-UI theme switcher without rebuild.
acceptanceCriteria: There are at least 2 distinct visual theme variants available (>=1 dark-only and >=1 color-theory-based).
Theme switching/preview is possible without rebuilding the app (e.g., toggle/selector in UI).
Typography, spacing, and component styling remain consistently sleek and minimal across variants.

file_operations.description: Define at least two theme variants (1 dark-only, 1 complementary/analogous palette) expressed as design tokens mapped to CSS variables compatible with the Tailwind/shadcn-ui token approach.
Create a lightweight ThemeProvider to store the selected theme in client state and apply it to the document (e.g., data attribute/class) so switching is instant and requires no rebuild.

Add a compact theme selector UI (e.g., dropdown/segmented control) to preview/switch themes. Use shadcn-ui Select/Button for a sleek control. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add global CSS variables for the two theme variants (including dark-only) and base typography/spacing defaults; ensure tokens align with the Tailwind config variables so shadcn-ui components automatically adapt. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire ThemeProvider and ThemeSwitcher into the app header so users can switch themes anywhere in the flow; ensure the layout stays concise and consistent across themes.

requirements.summary: Create a realistic registration form UI with client-side validation, inline errors, and validity-based primary action behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Form contains the specified fields with sensible input types (e.g., email input).
Client-side validation errors are shown inline and are understandable in English.
The primary action button reflects validity (disabled until required fields are valid or equivalent clear behavior).

file_operations.description: Implement client-side validation helpers for required fields and formats (student name, student ID, email, exam, session/date-time, agreement) and optional accommodations; return field-level error messages for inline display.
Define client-only types for the registration draft data used across screens (no persistence).

Implement the full form UI: student name, student ID, email, exam selection (or linked from Exam Selection), date/time/session selection, optional accommodations, and agreement checkbox; show inline validation messages and disable/enable the primary action based on validity. Use shadcn-ui Input/Label/Checkbox/Select/Button to keep styling sleek. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure exam selection is represented in client state and validated as required before proceeding; use shadcn-ui Select to keep interaction consistent. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Display all captured fields in a readable summary and prevent confirmation if required items are missing; keep confirmation action clearly primary and consistent with the disabled/enabled behavior.

requirements.summary: Establish and apply a consistent, uncluttered visual system (layout grid, typography, spacing, hierarchy) across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Screens share a consistent layout structure (header/content/actions) and spacing scale.
Primary/secondary actions are visually clear and consistent across screens.
UI remains uncluttered with a clear information hierarchy on each screen.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable layout wrapper enforcing a consistent structure (header, main content container, footer/actions area) and a shared spacing/typography scale across screens.

Add a minimal step indicator/header component to reinforce hierarchy and flow position without decorative clutter; use shadcn-ui typography/card styling conventions where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adopt AppShell and StepHeader so every screen uses the same layout grid, typography, and action placement; ensure primary/secondary action styling is consistent (e.g., primary filled button, secondary ghost/outline). Use shadcn-ui Button variants. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Define global base styles for typography scale, focus ring, and spacing rhythm (kept minimal) and ensure they apply consistently across all screens and theme variants.

requirements.summary: Make the draft UI responsive and accessible: mobile/desktop usability, keyboard navigation for the core flow, and sufficient contrast per theme.
acceptanceCriteria: Core flow is usable at common widths (mobile and desktop) without broken layout.
Interactive elements can be reached/activated via keyboard navigation for the primary flow.
Text and interactive elements have acceptable contrast in both dark-only and color-theory themes.

file_operations.description: Ensure responsive container sizing and spacing for mobile/desktop, including stacking actions on small screens and maintaining readable line-length on large screens.

Improve accessibility: proper label associations, aria attributes for inline errors, logical tab order, and keyboard-operable controls; ensure disabled state is communicated clearly and focus styles are visible. Use shadcn-ui inputs/checkbox/select for consistent accessible behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure selection controls are keyboard navigable and readable at mobile widths; maintain clear focus states. Use shadcn-ui Select/Button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure review content uses semantic structure (headings/definition-like layout) and that primary/secondary actions are reachable and clear via keyboard.

Adjust theme token values as needed to ensure sufficient contrast (text, borders, focus rings) in both the dark-only and color-theory theme variants; ensure a clear visible focus indicator across themes.
